H0.text: where did the tea come from in the boston tea party. China

H1.text: where did the tea come from in the boston tea party. India

H2.text: where did the tea come from in the boston tea party. Netherlands

H3.text: where did the tea come from in the boston tea party. England

A4.text: rival companies were formed to import the product from China, which was then governed by the Qing dynasty.

A5.text: the act required colonists to import their tea only from Great Britain.

A6.text: The East India Company had also been granted competitive advantages over colonial American tea importers to sell tea from its colonies in Asia in American colonies.

A7.text: The East India Company had eighteen million pounds of tea sitting in British warehouses.
